intro: Alectra aspera, commonly known as the rough bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately lobed, with a rough texture that gives it its common name. Alectra aspera typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands.
